items.sentence: I don't think that I'm the only one who's worried about Tom.
I don't think I'd be able to convince Tom to do that for us.
I don't think that either Tom or Mary has ever been in love.
I don't think that anyone really thought that Tom was happy.
I don't think that anybody really thought that Tom was busy.
Tom told me that he thought that you could probably do that.
Tom's mother hugged him and she told him that she loved him.
Tom told Mary that he'd finished the work three days before.
Tom adamantly denied he had anything to do with the robbery.
Tom knew there was a possibility that Mary wouldn't do that.
